meanings.sent1: The misgovernment led to chaos and confusion in the country.
meanings.sent2: The citizens were tired of the misgovernment and demanded change.
meanings.sent3: The misgovernment was so bad that even the pigeons in the park were complaining.
meanings.sent4: The misgovernment was like a leaky boat in a storm, unable to stay afloat.
meanings.sent5: The misgovernment was a dark cloud looming over the nation's progress.

meanings.definition: The act or process of governing poorly or corruptly.
meanings.sent1: The misgovernment of the officials caused widespread dissatisfaction among the people.
meanings.sent2: Corruption and misgovernment go hand in hand in many countries.
meanings.sent3: The misgovernment in the city council meetings often led to unintentional comedy.
meanings.sent4: The misgovernment was a poison slowly seeping into the roots of society.
meanings.sent5: The misgovernment was a stain on the history of the nation.
